hanzi-su-wiki:
憤

Значения

Возмущаться, негодовать

Мнемоника

Сердечный 忄 спазм, какой бывает при внезапном вручении венка 賁. Гнев и радость одинаково возбуждают сердце.

Варианты

愤
purpleculture_pinyin:
fèn
indignant; anger; resentment
возмущенный; злость; негодование
rtega_mnemonic:
憤憤RS
愤愤		resent, hate, indignant
  • ornamented 賁 heart 忄: rich person evoking much resentment and hatred
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 愤)
Pictophonetic: 賁 indicates the sound; 忄 (heart) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
憤怒 [ fèn nù ]: angry; indignant; wrath; ire
憤慨 [ fèn kǎi ]: to resent; resentment
憤恨 [ fèn hèn ]: to hate; hatred; to resent; embittered
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 忄 [ xīn ] heart; mind; soul
    • 賁 [ bì ] to forge ahead; energetic; surname
heisig_chinese_memo: Indignation here refers to anger over some unjust or wrong act. An angry state of mind is aroused when finding all your clams buried under your haystack stolen, gone!
heisig_constituent: aroused, Freud, state of mind, pitchfork, haystack, ten, needle, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, needle3, ten3
koohiiStory1: Note: this word in Japanese has the idea of "indignant". So aroused here refers to being aroused because of anger over some unjust or wrong act, unfairness etc. It doesn´t seem to carry a meaning associated with arousal in the sense of sex or pleasure. So, my story: think of the angry state of mind aroused at finding all your clams buried under your haystack stolen, gone!
koohiiStory2: Data was aroused/indignant when he saw what the volcano had done to the farmers building their haystacks and the fishermen collecting their shells . The tragedy of it all aroused him so much he didn´t even notice he was feeling emotion.
jp_example_words: 憤慨(ふんがい): indignation, resentment
WaniKani_Radicals: 忄, 十, 艹, 貝
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You see a soul on a cross covered in flowers with shellfish at its feet and you suddenly resent them. It's not like you want to be the one up there on the cross, but so many people left flowers and shellfish for them. It should have been you...
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the soul on the cross, flowers all around it and shellfish at its feet. Feel your resentment grow.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You realize you resent them because it looks like they're having fun (ふん). You aren't having fun, and you wanna be! How dare they have fun when you aren't!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You wanna have fun hanging out on a cross with flowers and all the shellfish you can eat. Your resentment grows and grows as you watch the soul having everything you suddenly want.
Ru_Radicals: ハ, 十 (десять), 忙 (занятой), 艾 (мокса), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the decorations (賁) make your heart (忄) indignant
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Sitting outside enjoying a late night bowl of chowder your state of mind becomes that of indignation when the drunk man come stumbling along and knocks your chowder on the ground.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " heart " to the sound of " ben ". The original meaning is depressed and depressed. "Shuowen": "Angry, stunned. From the heart, the sound." Such as "The Analects. "Shu Er": "If you are not angry, you will not be angry, you will not be angry." Zhu Xi's note: "The angry person seeks to understand the meaning without getting it." Don't inspire him. Another example is "Selected Works. Wang Zhongxuan "Deng Lou Fu": "Following the ranks and descending, I feel angry in my chest."

"Furious" means venting the depression in the heart. Such as "The Songs of the Chu. Chapter Nine. Cherish recitation: "Cherish recitation so as to be stunned, and be angry to express emotion." "Historical Records. "The Preface of Tai Shi Gong": "The three hundred pieces of "Poems" are probably what the virtuous sages have done in anger. This person all intends to be frustrated and cannot understand the way. Therefore, he tells the past and thinks about the person." "It means diligence and hard work. Such as "Historical Records. "Confucius Family": "He is also a man, he is tireless in learning, he is not tired of teaching others, he is angry and forgets food, happy to forget worry, and he does not know how old he is." It is also like the idiom "industrious to be strong" (also called "strive to be strong" ").

" Anger " extended to express anger and resentment. For example, Song Yu's "Da Yan Fu": "The strong man is angry with the heavens, and the Beidou is against the Taishan Yi." "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty. Emperor Guangwu": "The Han Dynasty was defeated by Wang Mang, the ancestral temple was abolished, the hero was angry, and the omnipotent was disgraced."

" Angry " also means fullness and fullness. Such as "Yi Zhou Shu. "Shi Xun" "Indignation and Indignation", Zhu Youzeng's training school explained: "Angry, Sheng Ye, Man Ye." "Zuo Zhuan. "The Fifteen Years of Xi Gong": "The chaos is cunning and angry, the blood is circulated, the pulse is unhappy, the outside is strong, the middle is dry." Kong Yingda Shu: "The chaos of the horse is cunning and full of anger.
humanum_short_description_en: From the " heart " to the sound of " ben ". The original meaning is depressed, depressed, and extended to express anger and resentment.
humanum_full_description:
從「心」，「賁」聲。本義是鬱悶、煩悶。《說文》：「憤，懣也。从心，賁聲。」如《論語．述而》：「不憤不啟，不悱不發。」朱熹注：「憤者，心求通而未得之意。」「不憤不啟」指不到苦思不通、鬱結於心時不去啟發他。又如《文選．王仲宣〈登樓賦〉》：「循階除而下降兮，氣交憤於胸臆。」

　　「發憤」表示發泄心中的鬱悶。如《楚辭．九章．惜誦》：「惜誦以致愍兮，發憤以抒情。」《史記．太史公自序》：「《詩》三百篇，大抵賢聖發憤之所為作也。此人皆意有所鬱結，不得通其道也，故述往事，思來者。」後亦同「發奮」，表示勤奮、奮發。如《史記．孔子世家》：「其為人也，學道不倦，誨人不厭，發憤忘食，樂以忘憂，不知老之將至。」又如成語「發憤圖強」（亦作「發奮圖強」）。

　　「憤」引申表示憤怒、憤恨。如宋玉〈大言賦〉：「壯士憤兮絕天維，北斗戾兮太山夷。」《後漢書．光武帝紀上》：「漢遭王莽，宗廟廢絕，豪傑憤怒，兆人塗炭。」

　　「憤」還表示充盈、充滿。如《逸周書．時訓》「陰氣憤盈」，朱右曾集訓校釋：「憤，盛也，滿也。」《左傳．僖公十五年》：「亂氣狡憤，陰血周作，張脈僨興，外彊中乾。」孔穎達疏：「言馬之亂氣狡戾而憤滿。」
humanum_short_description: 從「心」，「賁」聲。本義是鬱悶、煩悶，引申表示憤怒、憤恨。

憤慨(ふんがい): indignation, resentment

從「 心 」，「 賁 」聲。本義是鬱悶、煩悶。《說文》：「憤，懣也。从心，賁聲。」如《論語．述而》：「不憤不啟，不悱不發。」朱熹注：「憤者，心求通而未得之意。」「不憤不啟」指不到苦思不通、鬱結於心時不去啟發他。又如《文選．王仲宣〈登樓賦〉》：「循階除而下降兮，氣交憤於胸臆。」 「發憤」表示發泄心中的鬱悶。如《楚辭．九章．惜誦》：「惜誦以致愍兮，發憤以抒情。」《史記．太史公自序》：「《詩》三百篇，大抵賢聖發憤之所為作也。此人皆意有所鬱結，不得通其道也，故述往事，思來者。」後亦同「發奮」，表示勤奮、奮發。如《史記．孔子世家》：「其為人也，學道不倦，誨人不厭，發憤忘食，樂以忘憂，不知老之將至。」又如成語「發憤圖強」（亦作「發奮圖強」）。 「 憤 」引申表示憤怒、憤恨。如宋玉〈大言賦〉：「壯士憤兮絕天維，北斗戾兮太山夷。」《後漢書．光武帝紀上》：「漢遭王莽，宗廟廢絕，豪傑憤怒，兆人塗炭。」 「 憤 」還表示充盈、充滿。如《逸周書．時訓》「陰氣憤盈」，朱右曾集訓校釋：「憤，盛也，滿也。」《左傳．僖公十五年》：「亂氣狡憤，陰血周作，張脈僨興，外彊中乾。」孔穎達疏：「言馬之亂氣狡戾而憤滿。」

憤字的基本解释

憤字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fèn］
［《廣韻》房吻切，上吻，奉。］
“愤1”的繁体字。亦作“1”。
(1)郁结于心；憋闷。
(2)充盈，旺盛。
(3)发；奋。
(4)愤怒；怨恨。
(5)乱。

憤字的康熙字典解释

【卯集上】【心字部】　憤； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页403第19
【唐韻】【正韻】房吻切【集韻】【韻會】父吻切，?墳上聲。【說文】懣也。从心賁聲。【周語】陽癉憤盈。【註】積也。鬱積而怒滿也。　又【集韻】或作?。亦作賁。【禮·樂記】廣賁之音作，而民剛毅。【音義】依註讀爲憤，扶粉反。　又作馮。【莊子·盜跖篇】侅溺於馮氣，郭象讀。　又【韻會】【正韻】?房問切，音與分同。滿也。【論語】不憤不啓。【又】發憤忘食。◎按註?上聲，字書有上去二音。又叶符筠切，音焚。【蘇轍·祭范鎭文】力諫不從，遂致爲臣。開門接士，不怨不憤。

【說文】憤本字。憤字从芔作。

anger
Name meaning
fèn
вм. 愤
Radicals: 忄, 十, 艹, 貝  (soul, cross, flowers, shellfish)
Meaning Mnemonic
You see a soul on a cross covered in flowers with shellfish at its feet and you suddenly resent them. It's not like you want to be the one up there on the cross, but so many people left flowers and shellfish for them. It should have been you...
Picture the soul on the cross, flowers all around it and shellfish at its feet. Feel your resentment grow.
Reading Mnemonic
You realize you resent them because it looks like they're having fun (ふん). You aren't having fun, and you wanna be! How dare they have fun when you aren't!
You wanna have fun hanging out on a cross with flowers and all the shellfish you can eat. Your resentment grows and grows as you watch the soul having everything you suddenly want.
